page.title: 19TOTAL COMMUNICATION
page.content: At Donaldson's School for the Deaf in Edinburgh, the method of communication used is{TOTAL COMMUNICATION.}It involves the use of{speech, signed {English,lip_reading}and{residual {hearing.}In{SIGNED ENGLISH}each word is produced in{sign,finger_spelling } and {speech}in the correct word order. Two handed British finger spelling is used and {sign endings}illustrate grammatical structures,to help pupils read and write more fluently,speak more grammatically and understand the English language more fully. Any residual hearing is helped by the use of powerful{HEARING AIDS,}both{BODY {WORN}and{POST AURAL}and/or{RADIO AIDS} which are either{BODY WORN}or{PERSONAL {FM SYSTEMS.}Radio aids consist of a teacher's microphone and pupil's receiver.Each class has a coded frequency to avoid overspill.
